title: How to Artificially Inseminate Cows and Heifers

steps.title: Watch your cows and/or heifers for signs of estrus.
steps.content: Watch your cows and/or heifers for signs of estrus . Females go into heat once every ~21 days, and the heat periods themselves last for 24 hours. [1] X Research source Check out this article: How to Tell if a Cow or Heifer is in Estrus for physiological, behavioral and physical signs of heat. Most heat periods start or end around dusk or dawn.

steps.title: Twelve (12) hours after estrus is when females should be AI'd.
steps.content: Twelve (12) hours after estrus is when females should be AI'd. This time period is when the female ovulates, sending an ovum out to the fallopian tube to await fertilization from sperm from a bull. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Calmly, with proper handling practices put the heifers or cows in to the working alley to the squeeze chute (or alleyway with just a head gate is good enough), and catch the first female in the head gate.
steps.content: Calmly, with proper handling practices put the heifers or cows in to the working alley to the squeeze chute (or alleyway with just a head gate is good enough), and catch the first female in the head gate. If there are others behind her, make sure they are back behind another gate to prevent them from squishing you when they try to move up further in the race. If you have a squeeze chute with a palpation cage attached to it, use this as a means to do your AI'ing. Some barns are set up so that each cow is in a stanchion or head-catch lined up beside one another. This is very convenient for the AI tech who has to AI over 50 cows in one day! If doing AI outside, it is best to do it on sunny warm days, not when the weather is rainy or windy or even stormy. If you have a facility that is set up inside a shed or barn, so much the better!

steps.title: Prepare a water bath that is between 90 to 95 degrees Fahrenheit (or 34 to 35 degrees Celsius) in a thermos.
steps.content: Prepare a water bath that is between 90 to 95 degrees Fahrenheit (or 34 to 35 degrees Celsius) in a thermos. Use a thermometer for better accuracy.

steps.title: Identify which canister contains the semen you need.
steps.content: Identify which canister contains the semen you need. A semen inventory on the tank that keeps track of the location of each bull prevents any unnecessary searching.

steps.title: Remove the canister from its storage location to the center of the tank.
steps.content: Remove the canister from its storage location to the center of the tank. Lift the canister just high enough into the neck region of the tank to grasp the desired cane of semen. Keep the tops of the canister or canes no higher than the frost line, or two to three inches from the top of the tank.

steps.title: Grasp the desired cane then immediately lower the canister to the tank floor.
steps.content: Grasp the desired cane then immediately lower the canister to the tank floor. Keep the cane as low inside the tank as possible while removing the straw of semen with tweezers. You only have 10 seconds to take the semen straws out!!!

steps.title: Shake the straw to remove excess liquid nitrogen (nitrogen quickly goes into a gaseous state when exposed to air and warmer temperatures)
steps.content: Shake the straw to remove excess liquid nitrogen (nitrogen quickly goes into a gaseous state when exposed to air and warmer temperatures)

steps.title: Immediately place it the prepared thermos of water and keep it in there for 40 to 45 seconds.
steps.content: Immediately place it the prepared thermos of water and keep it in there for 40 to 45 seconds. [3] X Trustworthy Source Penn State Extension Educational organization dedicated to delivering science-based information to people, businesses, and communities Go to source The warm water should be around 95ºF (35ºC) for optimum thawing of the semen straws.

steps.title: After the straw is put in to the warm water, put the can back in the canister by raising the canister up and over the cane and return the canister to its storage position.
steps.content: After the straw is put in to the warm water, put the can back in the canister by raising the canister up and over the cane and return the canister to its storage position. [4] X Research source Anytime it takes over 10 seconds to locate a cane the canister must be lowered back into the tank to cool completely. Never return a unit of semen to the tank once you've removed it from the cane.

steps.title: Get your AI gun ready by having it pre-assembled (this should be done before/after you prep the thermos with warm water.
steps.content: Get your AI gun ready by having it pre-assembled (this should be done before/after you prep the thermos with warm water. If it's cold outside, warm the "business end" of the gun up in your coveralls close to your body so it warms up completely. Rubbing a paper towel on the rod also helps warm it up. If it's hot outside, keep it in a cool place. The AI gun should not be extremely hot nor cold to the touch.

steps.title: Remove the straw from the thermos and wipe it dry with a paper towel.
steps.content: Remove the straw from the thermos and wipe it dry with a paper towel. It should be completely dry before you do anything else with it. Flick your wrist slightly, while holding the crimped end, to adjust the air bubble in the straw. The flick should move the bubble to the end you are holding

steps.title: Put the straw in the rod.
steps.content: Put the straw in the rod. Clip 1/2" (or 1 cm) from the crimped end of the straw. Use sharp scissors or specially designed straw-cutter scissors should be used, and cut in the area that the air bubble is located.

steps.title: Wrap the AI gun in a clean dry paper towel or protective sheath and tuck it in your clothing close to your body to both transport it to the cow and to maintain a constant temperature.
steps.content: Wrap the AI gun in a clean dry paper towel or protective sheath and tuck it in your clothing close to your body to both transport it to the cow and to maintain a constant temperature.

steps.title: Move the tail so it's on top of your left forearm or tie it up so it will not interfere with the AI process.
steps.content: Move the tail so it's on top of your left forearm or tie it up so it will not interfere with the AI process. Raise the tail with one hand (preferably the right) and with the other (which should be gloved and lubricated), gently reach inside the cow to clean out any feces that may interfere with the process of feeling for and inserting the AI gun into the cow's vagina.

steps.title: Clean the vulva with a clean paper towel or rag to remove excess manure and debris.
steps.content: Clean the vulva with a clean paper towel or rag to remove excess manure and debris.

steps.title: Take the gun out of your jacket or overalls, unwrap it, then insert it at a 30 degree angle into the cow's vulva.
steps.content: Take the gun out of your jacket or overalls, unwrap it, then insert it at a 30 degree angle into the cow's vulva. This is so that you avoid going into the urethral opening into the bladder.

steps.title: With your left hand in the rectum of the cow (which should have been there to begin with), feel with your finger tips through the wall of the rectum and vagina the location of the end of the AI gun until you reach the cervix.
steps.content: With your left hand in the rectum of the cow (which should have been there to begin with), feel with your finger tips through the wall of the rectum and vagina the location of the end of the AI gun until you reach the cervix. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Grasp the cervix with the hand in the rectum of the cow (like you would hold a bar that is below your hand) and hold it steady while you thread the rod into and through the cow's cervix.
steps.content: Grasp the cervix with the hand in the rectum of the cow (like you would hold a bar that is below your hand) and hold it steady while you thread the rod into and through the cow's cervix.

steps.title: When the rod is all the way through the cervix, check the location with your index finger.
steps.content: When the rod is all the way through the cervix, check the location with your index finger. The rod should be only 1/2 to 1/4 of an inch into the uterus. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Slowly depress the plunger at the end where your right hand is so that 1/2 or is deposited.
steps.content: Slowly depress the plunger at the end where your right hand is so that 1/2 or is deposited.

steps.title: Recheck the location of the semen to make sure you are in the cow's uterus and not in any of her "blind spots" (see tips below), and deposit the other half of the straw's contents.
steps.content: Recheck the location of the semen to make sure you are in the cow's uterus and not in any of her "blind spots" (see tips below), and deposit the other half of the straw's contents.

steps.title: Slowly remove the AI gun, your hand and arm from inside the cow.
steps.content: Slowly remove the AI gun, your hand and arm from inside the cow. Check for any blood, infection or semen "feedback" from inside the sheath.

steps.title: Recheck the straw to see if you used the right bull semen for the cow.
steps.content: Recheck the straw to see if you used the right bull semen for the cow.

steps.title: Dispose the straw, glove, and towels in the proper place.
steps.content: Dispose the straw, glove, and towels in the proper place.

steps.title: Clean the AI gun if necessary.
steps.content: Clean the AI gun if necessary.

steps.title: Record breeding information on any record keeping system you have on hand.
steps.content: Record breeding information on any record keeping system you have on hand.

steps.title: Release the cow (if necessary, depending on the breeding set-up you have) and restrain the next one to be inseminated.
steps.content: Release the cow (if necessary, depending on the breeding set-up you have) and restrain the next one to be inseminated.

steps.title: Recheck the temperature of the water in the thermos before repeating the steps above for another cow.
steps.content: Recheck the temperature of the water in the thermos before repeating the steps above for another cow.

steps.title: Repeat the steps above for the next cow.
steps.content: Repeat the steps above for the next cow.
